column4: Does someone have a recommendation for a PPPoE dialer in Ubuntu?
ppp oe and dialer ... emm network or dialer?
is your connection to a router at this time?
so just enabling the network interface should work for you
just enable the network card to talk tcp/ip the pppoe stuff should be on the other side of the switch and therefore not your concern (with a bit if luck())
for me, each machine on my network has to log in (and yes, I get a real public IP for each machine this way).
so are the addresses static or dynamic?
so just choose dhcp and it should work for you
please try that and then if that does not work I will do some digging using uncle google
I got it working using pppoeconf. :)
ehh if you should have installed a server - the fastest way to get there is to install the server rather than trying to take out gnome etc
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop ; sudo apt-get install rcconf      << sudo rcconf and turn off gdm for next reboot >> enjoy
